name: Courtyard New York Manhattan/Midtown East

reviews.title: Great Place to Stay in NYC
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. It was an excellent experience from check-in until check-out. Our bellman was super and took a great deal of interest in us. He set up our departure to the airport for Thursday, early morning. The room was spacious with a clean bathroom. The bathroom was well supplied with ample clean towels, shampoos and lotions, and a working hair dryer. We left our maid a tip each morning. Each night we would return to receive a handwritten thank you note for that tip. We have done a lot of travel worldwide, and have NEVER had the maid write us a thank you note!! We were impressed and our room was well cared for. We were on the 25th floor and got very little street noise. We found plenty of delis and great places to get a snack within close walking distance. We travelled by taxi to some of the places we wanted to go (Macy's, theater district 2 nights) and only had to wait seconds for a cab to arrive. If you will be traveling by subway, there are 2 terminals just steps away. There is a pharmacy next door and a news stand out front. In our opinion, what more could you want??

reviews.title: Clean, Huge rooms; perfect location!
reviews.text: I went on a weekend vacay with my husband and son (age 5) and not only did we check in early but also when we noticed a small mistake on out bill, it was fixed within minutes of a call down to the front desk. The location is also very convenient, close to all of my sons favorite spots... Central Park, FAO Schwartz and Dylans candy bar!! And for mom... a great shoe store right up the street! How can you go wrong? I will continue to stay here year after year as long as the staff and management keep up their impeccable service and standards. All in all the best room for the price in NY, bar none!

reviews.title: Second Stay at the Courtyard Midtown
reviews.text: I personally LOVE this hotel, it is so convenient to everything and everyone at the hotel is so nice!! You can not beat the price $265 a night including taxes. We were in town for one night, March 14th to attend a cheerleading competition for my daughter. We booked a King Room with a pull out couch and it was perfect for the 3 of us. I should of requested a corner room which I have had in the past, they are definitely bigger. We had dinner at the Pig n the Whistle down the street and it was great, they were so nice to my daughter even though we were there during Happy Hour. The first time I stayed it was for a Girl's Weekend in the City and we had a corner room with 2 doubles, plus the pullout. It was perfect. We enjoyed breakfast both mornings in the hotel. This stay we had to be out by 7am for the competition. They even held our luggage for the entire day for us, it was a great stay and we can not wait to go back!!

reviews.title: Great Hotel. Recommend it to Everyone!
reviews.text: I go to NY every January for my annual birthday trip and have stayed at this particular Courtyard Marriott 3 times now. I cannot say enough about this hotel. If you are looking for swank and fancy, it isn't that but it is very, very nice and the rooms are HUGE. From what I understand this building used to be a book distributor?? Something like that.... I think that really contributed to the size of the rooms when the marriott took it over. However, important to note that the bathrooms are not huge. It is obviously cheaper to stay in the winter but even at that we ONLY paid $174 a night and for NY that is really, really good. I booked it in either Oct or November on the actual Marriott website so if you are planning a trip, just keep checking their website because the prices can change on a daily basis.

reviews.title: Loved this hotel, will definately stay here again.
reviews.text: Now, the reasons why I love this hotel. First, location, location, location! You are blocks from 5th AVE, Rockefeller Center where the Ice Rink (in the winter only) NBC Studios etc. Time Square. We walk to all of these places from the Hotel. I would say that Time Square would be your furthest point and that is aprox. 15 blocks. If you walk up to 5th AVE and make a left and go up about 10 blocks you are at Central Park. Great, Great restaurants surrounding this hotel. Small, cute quaint places to eat from Italian to Mexican. There is a Starbucks around the corner, a 24 Hour Duane Reed Drug store directly next door and the subway station stairs right in front as well. A Washington Mutual Bank across the street. The Hotel also has Laundry Facilities with washers and dryers and a business center with computers to print your boarding passes or what ever you need to do on the Internet FREE. Free coffee and Tea on that floor as well. A small restaurant and a fitness room that isn't too bad. Only disappointment is that they closed the Bar/Lounge when I was there in Jan 2007. No longer a place to have coctails in the hotel but there are plenty of places to go right up the street. As you can tell, I highly recommend this hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Courtyard Midtown lived up to every great review I have seen on Tripadvisor. It was centrally located and one of the main subway lines was 20 steps away from the front door. (You can take the subway E line uptown from Penn Station to the stop at Lexington and 53rd and follow the exit signs to 3rd Avenue.) The staff was friendly and our room was ready upon arrival. The hotel room was very clean and large with a king bed and a sofa-no stains or funny smells. Incredibly comfy bed--no nasty bedbugs(I looked!) and no other creepy crawlies that I could spot. The hotel was very quiet and every staff member we met said hello and asked if they could help us--they told us about places to eat that stayed open late, mailed postcards for us. They also checked our room keys when we walked past the lobby to make sure we were actually staying there-a nice safety feature. In the lobby, they have excellent free maps of Manhattan with clearly marked Subway stops. I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel to anyone staying in NYC-we paid $229/night plus tax which I understand is quite a bargain for the city.
reviews.title: Loved Our Stay over St Patrick's Day!
Lovely hotel, Nice staff
reviews.text: I'll admit I am a total tripadvisor junkie. I never book any hotel w/o checking with TA first. I was a little doubting that a Courtyard could be as great as all the TA reviewers stated but I have to say this place was extremely nice. The rooms are large and newly renoveated. And the staff was excellent. I was traveling with my young daughter who became sick while in NYC and the staff were very accommodating; late check out, extra towels, a ride to the airport. It is in a very convenient neighborhood and only a 4 block walk to shopping on 5th Ave. While it was not cheap ($284 plus tax) , I would definitely use this place again.

reviews.title: Decent deal, good location
reviews.text: This is a very typical hotel but the rooms are nicely renovated and we were surprised at the large size, unusual for Manhattan. They don't offer many extras (like no room service or mini-bar), and the doorman was on the take with the airport car service, but with the subway steps away, a 24hr drug store next door and an easy walk to some of the best attractions, we would recommend this hotel for tourists who want location.

Just returned from a great trip to NYC with my friend from NC. Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. Girls trip to help my daughter buy a wedding gown. We checked in late (midnight) and we were exhausted and hungry due to flight delays. The staff was wonderful. Even upgraded my room when we checked in. Very Very spacious, especially for NYC. Had great recommendations for places near by to eat.
reviews.title: Great Deal!

likes.disliked: — Size of the Bathroom vanity area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loved the location! Not in the middle of a 3 ring circus, but easy access to transportation, sights, shopping and felt safe when out at night.
reviews.title: Courtyard Midtown Great price and Area!

likes.liked: — Clean, plenty of space in room, good view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently spent a weekend here. Rooms were well maintained. Staff was friendly and helpful. An above average value for the money
reviews.title: Good Value

reviews.text: I would definately recommend this hote!
reviews.title: Great, Great, Great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have just returned from a 4 night stay at the Courtyard Marriott Midtown East on the corner of 53rd&3rd.
reviews.title: Spacious

reviews.text: There were 4 of us altogether, myself and 3 friends.
reviews.title: Excellent midtown hotel

reviews.text: We all stayed in the one room, on the 16th floor, it was what they call a queen queen deluxe.
reviews.title: Typical Marriott Brand Standards . . . Loved It!

likes.liked: — Size of the room and amenities.
likes.disliked: — Restaurant/Lounge (knew what was available though at booking)

reviews.title: Great hotel for the money....
reviews.text: Originally had booked a more expensive 4.5 star hotel at twice the price, but heard very good things about the Marriott Courtyards in NYC and we're glad we switched. Just a great experience for the price...it is still a Courtyard and you can't get too excited but the service, location, cleanliness and the great price (keeping in mind it is NYC at the Christmas / New Year holiday time) made it a hotel we're pleased to recommend and plan on staying there in the future.

reviews.title: great location, hotel is just ok
reviews.text: Just got back from a one night stay at the Courtyard Midtown with husband and two teenagers. The good points are that the room size is large with 2 queens and a pull-out. Our room was on the 16th floor with no view. We looked at an office building out our small windows. The bathroom has a door which opens into the room on an automatic hinge so anytime you use it the door swings shut. I found that to be very annoying. The room was very quiet and the beds were comfortable.

reviews.title: cool hotel
reviews.text: There is a tiny lobby area which is very crowded especially at check in because there is no place for luggage. I prefer the large spacious lobbies of other ny city hotels, not this cramped dark space. The concierge was not very helpful and did not give us a good restaurant recommendation so do your own research. We walked to everything but there is a subway one block away.

There is a fabulous market called Azure at 51st and 3rd with every possible food choice you could ask for. They have seating on the 2nd floor or you can get it to go. The restaurant on the 12th floor is good for breakfast. I would probably stay somewhere else next time because this place lacks the glam factor which is why we go to New York.
reviews.title: Functional city centre hotel.

reviews.text: i like it!
reviews.title: A great trip and a great hotel

likes.liked: — the location, room size, staff and cleanliness

reviews.text: Very large rooms, helpful congierge, easy to walk to Grand Central area,Rockerfeller Plaza, an even Times Square.
reviews.title: Wonderful staff, great location
recommend
reviews.text: we stayd in a quad room which was incredibly spacious. Nothing bad to say...

Hotel rooms in NYC are usually similar to London: overpriced and small. Rooms in NYC are usually so small you can barely move around. Based on the reviews from this website, I decided to give the Residence Inn a try. I was expecting a little bit bigger room, but I was blown away by the size of the room. It's probably 3x as big as a normal Westin/Marriott/Sheraton room. A king bed, sofa, full kitchen, flat screen TV, windows that open, free breakfast, free internet. It's not the level of a Four Seasons, but it's very nice indeed. My one complaint is that they really don't have a doorman to help you get a cab, etc. The staff is friendly.
reviews.title: Phenomenal Value, Really Nice Hotel

reviews.text: We stayed 7 nights in this hotel and our choice was based on all the good reviews. We were not disappointed. Having 2 teenagers, boy 14 and girl 17 we booked a king suite, so they didn't have to sleep together in 1 bed. The room was unbelievably huge; 2 big rooms with a long hallway with 3 closets to put in all our clothes! We asked for an extra rollaway bed, but actually there was not a very good spot to place it. So finally our son slept on kind of a lounge chair next to our king size bed (bye bye privacy!). Our daughter slept on the pull-out sofabed in the livingroom which was not very comfortable and in our opinion not suitable for 2 people (beware!). We were a bit disappointed in the size of the bathroom, which was well equipped but very small for 4 people. Such a big room should have 2 bathrooms or an extra showerroom....Staff was very friendly and helpful. Views from the room were fantastic! Location superb, many good restaurants at walking distance, very good breakfastrestaurant (ess a bagel) if you like the real american bagel! The bellman was also very helpful. He arranged a taxi to take us to the airport and we got a stretch limousine for the price of a normal taxi, that was very comfy! Will certainly come again, but next time maybe book a double queen to save a bit of money (the suite was 560 dollars!).
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

likes.liked: — lot's of space in the room, the view and the location

reviews.text: Have just returned from a short break of 6 nights. There were 6 of us. Our rooms were next to each other on the 26th floor with great views of Manhattan and the Chrysler Building. Rooms were a good size with two large doubles and a a small sofa bed. Very quiet. Friendly and knowlegable reception staff and concierge. We didn't eat in the hotel. Breakfast was taken in one of the many local diners and we then ate whereever we happened to be. Fantastic location we were able to walk to most places and the subway which was very easy to use was round the corner. Free internet service in the business centre to book our return seats. Our travel agent booked our taxi service to JFK but the hotel was actually cheaper.
reviews.title: Being 50 in New York!

reviews.text: The Marriott courtyard Midtown is an odd mix: spacious rooms, a nice sofa bed for a third traveler, a cramped exit, mediocre bathroom, rough staff (with the exception of the person who turned down our beds) and a lobby that has all of the ambiance of Penn Station.
reviews.title: Acceptable but odd

reviews.text: I would be willing to stay here again but my traveling companions laid down the law - next time we travel to New York city we are going to stay at a hotel with a bit of style and personality.
reviews.title: great stay at the courtyard manhattan

reviews.text: we stayed for two nights at the courtyard manhattan and i can't say good enough about this hotel.
reviews.title: Good for Business

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we arrived at 11 am as we had an early flight from europe and i was worried not to get the room until the afternoon, but as soon as we get at the reception they told me the room was ready, what a good thing after 8 hours flight !
reviews.title: Really liked the Courtyard Midtown

reviews.text: The room is really big, especially for New York standars (have been in NY three times before even in better categories of Hotel but never got such a big room), very clean. Only the bathroom is a little bit tight, but no problem with that.
reviews.title: Good Choice in Manhattan

reviews.text: Have been to New York several times and by far this is the best hotel i've had the good fortune to stay in. I know a lot of people say the hotel isnt a huge part of the holiday, but i for one like to come back from a busy day to somewhere that is warm, comfortable and i dont need to check for bugs!!!
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.text: This hotel is a real gem, the rooms are large (especially for New York) with plenty of room for suitcases and shopping -i stayed with 3 friends and we still had loads of floorspace for more purchases.
reviews.title: Super Covenient and Great Value
Great Family Christmas NYC Trip
reviews.text: The staff were all very friendly and were very quick to come to our assistance when required - a very stubborn wine cork being dealt with with good humour!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good location about 4 blocks from Rockafellar Center. Basic amenities, no restaurant but there was a exercise room which we didn't use. Clean room, quiet, spacious, & a very comfortable bed. A 24 hr pharmacy is right next door. Perfectly acceptable for any stay in Manhattan especially considering how expensive it can be to get a hotel room. I would stay there again.
reviews.title: Good Value

reviews.text: Two adults and two teenage sons - we were all very comfortable. The room was large, with two queen beds plus a pullout sofa. The hotel staff was courteous and helpful. The location turned out to be better than we expected - close enough to walk to great restaurants and attractions, yet still quiet enough in the evenings. Subway stop just steps from hotel entrance. We will definitely stay here again. Great choice for families!
reviews.title: Great choice for family lodging

likes.liked: — Size of room, cleanliness, comfortable beds, location.

reviews.text: We origionally planned to visit New York last Christmas, however, our plans changed and we rescheduled for Easter - this meant that we were able to stay for 7 nights instead of 4 for the same cost. Our Children were excited to visit New York and it was a nice surprise to be able to check into our room early since we had been travelling since 5 a.m. British time. The room was spacious, clean and had a safe, iron, ironing board and hair dryer. We had requested a fridge and extra towels and these were in our room on arrival. Complimentary tea and coffee were provided - in the bathroom, strangely but were much appreciated. On floor 12 there is a computer with internet access which I used on the night prior to our departure to check-in to our flight, on line. Tea and coffee also available on this floor.
reviews.title: New York City - With Kids!!

likes.disliked: — Got to see a room on the 31st floor and the view was terrific- it looked over the Chrysler building. we were on 18th floor and it was ok.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were very helpful, especially the Concierge who helped with all our enquiries and who sold us tickets for the tour buses - you can buy an all loops ticket and travel uptown, downtown and to Brooklyn - although quite expensive we found this a good way to get around as each bus had a guide and some were entertaining - no traffic moves quickly in Manhattan. The night tour downtown and across the Manhattan bridge and back was spectacular even though snow was blowing in the air!! Enjoyed meals at the Midtown Restaurant on E55th Street - excellent breakfast and diinner and just 2 blocks from the hotel.
reviews.title: A Good Choice
Large rooms, a little off the path... but still a great safe place!
reviews.text: When we arrived, we learned we had been upgraded to a larger corner room (we were a couple). It was fresh and clean with multiple windows with great city views. The staff was friendly.

reviews.title: New Year
reviews.text: For a rather low price I booked this along with a flight. We stayed on a higher floor which was very quiet - even New Year's Eve! I have stayed in many Manhattan hotels and this location and size of room were among the best. They let us check in early, we had a clean and spacious room and the hotel staff could not have been friendlier. Will stay again. The only glitch was I was charged for parking and I had no vehicle.

We found this property to be more than expected. The staff was friendly and very helpful. Our room was spacious with 2 queen beds and a sofa bed. The beds and pillows were so comfortable. I don't believe I have ever slept so well away from home. The hotel is located at 3rd Ave and 53rd and only steps from the subway. We were within walking distance of Central Park. Rockefeller Center and the hustle and bustle of Times Square were only minutes away by taxi or subway. The location was clean and we felt safe at all hours day or night even on the subway. We highly recommend this hotel property and will defintely stay here again on our next trip to NY.
reviews.title: Loved the Courtyard Midtown East

reviews.text: The hotel does not have a pool, although it does have a good fitness room. I'll look forward to using this hotel again when visiting NYC.
reviews.title: Superb location, great rooms

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for a Christmas holiday weekend with 4 young kids and 2 grandparents. The hotel is in a GREAT location to Radio City, Times Square and Rockfeller Center, etc. We walked to all of the sights with 4 kids under 6 years of age with little effort. The room was spacious for NYC standards and the staff was very friendly and helpful. We were able to check in early which was a huge plus. The parking was a little pricey and you could probably save finding a parking garage on your own but worth the convenience. I totally recommend this hotel to anyone planning a stay in NYC. We will be returning.
reviews.title: Great Location, Decent Hotel

likes.disliked: — Lack of closet space and billing issues.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a very enjoyable stay. Staff was very friendly - front desk, doorman, wait staff at restaurant. Was able to find a reasonable rate via Travelocity. Had breakfast in the Cafe on the 12th floor - breakfast buffet was $17, but very good. Utilized parking through Marriott and that was very convenient. They park the car for you, and give them 30 mins and they will bring your car around. They went as far as to stand in the street to make sure you are able to pull out of the spot. Had a corner room on the 28th floor, which had walls of windows. Room was very nice sized, especially for NYC. There were 2 thermostats and could adjust heat/AC easily.
reviews.title: met my high expectations

likes.liked: — location, staff friendliness, nice sized room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Will stay here again, as long as I can get a good rate!
reviews.title: Convenient and Easy

likes.disliked: — Internet in room didn't work well

reviews.title: bed bugs...came away with lots of welts
reviews.text: This hotel was great--as someone who finds NYC to be quite intimidating, this hotel was anything but. The staff was super-friendly; checking in and out was a breeze; the room was huge and very clean; and the fitness center was great (and free--the hotel website says there's a charge to use it, but there wasn't).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Located in a quieter area, but just a short walk to Times Square and Rockefeller Center with plenty of restaurants and shopping all around, we had a great time! I would highly recommend it.
reviews.title: Great place, great location

likes.disliked: — no fancy decoration, room or lobby

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I love staying at MARRIOTT'S, but when i left this one with welts on my backside and rump, I was not happy. And, because I left at 6 am, the severity of the welts did not reach their apex until I was well away from New York City. No, I did not call the hotel, but never will stay there again.
reviews.title: Absolutely loved this hotel...

likes.liked: — The room...spacious, clean and very comfortable

reviews.text: Stayed here just one night, but would gladly have stayed longer if possible! The location was perfect for business and sightseeing, the staff were welcoming and friendly, and they gave us a VERY spacious corner room. The room was well appointed and MUCH larger than a typical New York room. Will stay here again when possible.
reviews.title: Friendly staff, huge room, great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a great stay at the Courtyard New York Manhattan. The room was big and clean!!!! The hotel staff were friendly and attentive to all our questions. The location was excellent for getting to the broadway shows and other attractions. The food in the restaurant was also very good. We cannot wait to visit again. Also this is a great hotel for anyone on business travel.
reviews.title: Great, Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I have stayed here on two occasions. We love the location - midtown gives you access to everything incluing subway, shopping etc.
reviews.title: Great location - just avergae (at best) hotel
Very Impressed
reviews.text: After staying in some dubious accomodation last time we visited New York, I was a bit worried.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for two weeks and was able to book a 'long term stay' which meant we got the best room in the hotel at very reasonable rates.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: We had the King Suite which was huge. It had three built in wardrobes, seperated living area, massive king bedroom, microwave, two tvs and of course a great view.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: I wouldnt bother with the breakfast on offer, go to 'essa bagel' across the street theyre an institution in NY.
reviews.title: Great Location for us..

reviews.text: Not sure if hes still there but Terry at the front desk was one of the nicest staff weve ever encountered.
reviews.title: Great Stay - Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Friend and I went for a girl's weekend of shopping and kicking up our heels. Loved the hotel! We walked to Madison and Park avenues easily to shop the really upper end stores. Easily found the subway to venture down to Soho and Chinatown for more shopping and bargains! Staff was so friendly!!!! Extra thanks to the security boys for helping us to our rooms when we "needed a little help" on Friday night! Can't wait to do it again next year!
reviews.title: Stimulated the Economy...partied like Rock Stars!

likes.disliked: — Only one sink in the bathroom!

reviews.text: Pretty good hotel. A short walk (but very doable) from most of the “action” therefore it is a bit less expensive. I stayed there on 4 different occasions in 2008 and the staff, rooms and experiences were all good.
reviews.title: Good affordible Hotel

reviews.text: As many others have said this is a great choice. This was my 5th trip to NYC and generally have stayed closer to the Time Square area but this was a refreshing change. The rooms really are BIG, there were 4 of us in the one room and it worked out great and saved us a fortune. We had breakfast our first morning at the hotel it was very nice with freshley cooked eggs, omelettes, pancakes and waffles but a bit pricey compared to what you can get outside.We had a room on the 27th floor with a fabulous view of both the river and the beautiful Chrysler Building. All the staff were exceptionally nice and i would certainly stay here agan. We used Dial7 for our transport to and from Newark and they were excellent. Stay here , you wont be dissapointed.
reviews.title: Perfect choice!!

likes.disliked: — No bar or restaurant in the evening

reviews.text: A great place to stay. We had a 3 night stay here in late November early December 08. A Yellow Cab from JFK to here was $49.50 ($45 flat rate to anywhere in Manhattan from JFK) including the toll for the bridge (dont ask which one as I haven't clue) .Although it is the only place I have stayed in New York, having spoken to some friends, this hotel seems to be one of the best on a reasonable budget.
reviews.title: Top Notch

likes.disliked: — Shallow toilet bowl leads to splashback and cold genitals (maybe not everyone)

reviews.text: All 3+ star hotels in Manhattan are expensive. What makes them less/more expensive are their location and room size. Luckily this hotel offers clean, large rooms in a great location for a mid range budget. Better to get a decent hotel in a nice location than go for a low budget accomodation in a seedy part of town.
reviews.title: Mom and daughter NYC adventure
Great Stay, Great Location
reviews.text: Have just returned from a great stay at the Courtyard New York Manhattan. I was travelling with my husband and two step-daughters and we wanted a hotel that was conveniently located, reasonably priced and with large enough rooms for us all to share (to save some money). We looked on Trip Advisor and decided to look on the hotel website due to the very favourable reviews. We managed to get a room to sleep the 4 of us (2 queen beds and a sleeper sofa) for $270 a night (incl taxes). We thought this was very reasonable for the 4 of us. I asked for a high floor room which is what we got and it had great views of the Chrysler Building and the UN Building. The room was very spacious and the beds were comfortable which is very important when you're spending all day and night walking around the city.

reviews.title: Marvellous stay at the Courtyard
reviews.text: The staff were very friendly and kindly reserved us a town car to take us back to JFK. This only cost $55 including the toll. You pay $45 just for a taxi and that doesn't include the toll so it was nice to travel back to the airport in a little more style.

reviews.title: Great stay and service for newly married couple.
reviews.text: We didn't eat breakfast in the hotel as we preferred to try out some of the cafes in the city.

reviews.title: Loved It!
reviews.text: At night we walked down to the Pig and Whistle pub which is about 200yds down the road and there was a really good buzz about the place. You could eat there too and the range of food was fine, but you're not talking gourmet. It was very reasonable for the price. We also ate at the Outback Steakhouse one night when we didn't want to walk far after being out for 12 hours during the day. Again, the food was very nice and reasonably priced.

reviews.title: No surprises!
reviews.text: We did all of the touristy things whilst in NYC, including the Sex & the City tour which was really good fun. Not for men though (my husband went to the pub) and not suitable for anyone under 18 (if you've seen the show you'll know what I mean). If you want a good time with the girls you'll love it. We also went to see Chicago on Broadway which was fantastic.

reviews.title: Great location and excellent staff
reviews.text: We stayed at the Courtyard March 8-15, 2008 and we really enjoyed our stay. We reserved the king suite because our party had five guests and this was the only room that could accomodate this many. Warning: do not book this hotel through a hotel finding website, book with Marriott directly if you have more than four guests in one room. Anyway, about our stay...our room was unbelievably spacious! We had six large pieces of luggage between us and there was room for all that and more. There were two closets and a long hallway where we set up the ironing board and left it out - the hall was that wide. We had a corner room so the hallway led from the living room, wrapped around the bathroom and went to a separate large bedroom. There was one bathroom, but there is a sink in the living room where my daughter and I brushed our teeth when the bathroom was in use. There is a microwave and mini fridge by the sink, and both the living room and the bedroom had a t.v. with free cable, including HBO. The living room also has a high speed internet connection and the room has a ton of outlets to plug in phone chargers, battery chargers and whatever else you need to plug in. The bathroom comes with a small table to put your toiletries, and a hair dryer. The water pressure isn't great, but it's adequate. What I found most appealing about the hotel is the staff. Being my first trip to New York, I heard people here are so busy, they don't care about you, but the staff here was absolutely the best! Every morning we were greeted warmly by the concierge whose desk sits right near the elevators. Every evening when we walked in we were greeted just as warmly by the front desk staff, who made sure our two daughters knew they gave out free cookies every evening. One night when we had problems with food poisoning from a local restaurant at 1am, we were furnished with new bedding and towels two minutes after we called them. When we were asking about transportation for the ride back to the airport at the end of our stay, they made sure they told us about another service - the Lincoln Town Car service - which costed exactly the same as a taxi would have, but was much more comfortable, and could be reserved in advance. When we got to the lobby at 8:30am, the cars were waiting for us and had been waiting around the corner since just after 8! No worries or stress about being able to hail a cab or finding other transportation - what a great service. You reserve the Town Car with the bellman the day before. This hotel is located in what is mostly a business district, so a walk around the block has several options for eating. Right across 3rd Ave. is a building with a food court one floor below street level. We found Cosmo Crepery there where we had a nice breakfast one morning, pancakes for the kids (one 3-stack portion was enough for my two children to share), and large crepes filled with meats and vegetables for the adults, quite delicious. A one-block walk west then one block north will bring you to Hale and Hearty Soups, a great little soup/salad/sandwich place on the corner of 54th and Lexington. Their main clientele are the business lunch crowd so by the evening rush they run out of some of their soups. Of course there is a Duane Reade Pharmacy/Store right downstairs where you can buy Cup O' Noodles and water, or cereal and milk, if you would rather dine in your room. Our hotel had a convenient Metro (subway) station right on the corner of 53rd and 3rd. The blue and orange lines stop here which can take you to Rockefeller Center (orange) or Times Square (blue). A short walk underground to the green line gets you south to Grand Central Station or north to the Bronx. My sister said that when she goes back to New York again next month, she will be staying here again because the hotel was the best - the best location, the best staff, and the best room. I highly recommend it to anyone.

reviews.title: Best quality/price in NYC
reviews.text: I booked two rooms last February. My wife, my daughter and I stayed in one room and my sister and her friend who were visiting from Europe stayed in the other room. The hotel location is great. The lobby is deceiving compared to the rooms which are nicely appointed, large for NY standard and comfortable. The bathroom is nothing different than your typical hotel bathroom but with more amenities. The room was large enough to have a king size bed, a pull out couch and a table without feeling tight. And they do not charge more if you use the pull out couch. The bed was comfortable and pillows smelled fresh. The staff was very friendly. This is the best quality/price hotel I have ever found in NYC. Two nice French restaurants nearby - Le Bateau Ivre - www.lebateauivrenyc.com/ - and Le Montparnasse - montparnasseny.com. They serve brunch too.

reviews.title: Just like the reviews
reviews.text: Having read all the reviews for this hotel, we were worried that it couldn't be as good or as cost effective as it sounded. It was! We stayed from 24-27 Feb and had a pleasant stay. Our room was a good size, comfortable beds and spotlessly clean. The staff were all helpful and friendly. The subway was close by so it didn't matter that it wasn't right next to Times Square, and we prefered the quieter location. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet with freshly cooked waffles and omelets. If you are looking for a hotel with a really large lobby area, lots of lounges and fancy bars etc etc, this is probably not the hotel for you, although there is a small sitting area with computers etc upstairs. We would definitely stay here on our next trip to New York

reviews.title: BEST HOTEL... defo book this one...
reviews.text: We stayed for 3nights. Booked this hotel after reading reviews on here. This website was great help. Hotel was much better than i thought tho. Hotel is spotless, rooms are AMAZING and massive.. The bed is amazing, just what you need after a day in NYC.

reviews.title: No place better.
reviews.text: We woke up at 4am as we were still on british time, so we went down to 12th floor and used free internet, located next to the 24hour free tea and coffe, was great.. breakfast there was great aswell.

aka: Courtyard By Marriott New York Manhattan / Midtown East Hotel
